annotations.title: annotations

enabled.description: deploy the database pod?  if false, a connection string to a SQL Server will need to be provided through one of the configuration providers.
enabled.title: enabled

tag.description: Tag of the image to use. (Defaults to general.coreVersion)
tag.title: tag

labels.title: labels

nodeSelector.description: Optionally place deployment on specifc nodes
nodeSelector.title: nodeSelector

podAnnotations.description: Additional annotations to the MSSQL pod
podAnnotations.title: podAnnotations

podLabels.description: Additional labels to the MSSQL pod
podLabels.title: podLabels

podSecurityContext.description: This will set the Kubernetes pod security context (including fsGroup)
podSecurityContext.title: podSecurityContext

podServiceAccount.description: Run the pod under a service account you create.  This is especially useful for OpenShift deployments
podServiceAccount.title: podServiceAccount

resources.description: The container is limited to the resources below.  Adjust for your environment.
resources.title: resources

securityContext.description: This will set the Kubernetes container security context
securityContext.title: securityContext

updateStrategy.description:
Specifies the strategy used to replace old Pods by new ones. The value can be "OnDelete" or "RollingUpdate". "OnDelete" is the default value.
When set to OnDelete, the SQL pod will not be recreated automatically on update.  It must be manually deleted to update.
updateStrategy.title: updateStrategy

volume.description: The MSSQL volumes for the PVCs

size.description:
Use an existing PVC by specifying the name.
existingClaim: claimName
Override the accessMode specified in general.volumeAccessMode
accessMode: ReadWriteOnce
Override the storageClass specified in sharedStorageClassName
storageClass: "shared-storage"
size.title: size

size.description:
Use an existing PVC by specifying the name.
existingClaim: claimName
Override the accessMode specified in general.volumeAccessMode
accessMode: ReadWriteOnce
Override the storageClass specified in sharedStorageClassName
storageClass: "shared-storage"
size.title: size

size.description:
Use an existing PVC by specifying the name.
existingClaim: claimName
Override the accessMode specified in general.volumeAccessMode
accessMode: ReadWriteOnce
Override the storageClass specified in sharedStorageClassName
storageClass: "shared-storage"
size.title: size

volume.title: volume

fullnameOverride.description: Optional - Override the chart name if desired
fullnameOverride.title: fullnameOverride

admins.description: Comma-separated list of email addresses for Admin users
admins.title: admins

annotations.description: Custom annotations to add throughout the installation
annotations.title: annotations

cloudRegion.description: Cloud region for sync.  Please see: https://bitwarden.com/help/families-for-enterprise-self-hosted/#step-1-enable-cloud-communication
cloudRegion.title: cloudRegion

coreVersionOverride.description: Override application container version tags.  Theses will be versioned with the chart and need not be changed in most circumstances.
coreVersionOverride.title: coreVersionOverride

disableUserRegistration.description: Disable account registration on web vault
disableUserRegistration.title: disableUserRegistration

replyToEmail.description: Email address used for invitations, typically no-reply
replyToEmail.title: replyToEmail

smtpHost.description: Your SMTP server hostname (recommended) or IP address
smtpHost.title: smtpHost

smtpPort.description: The SMTP port used by the SMTP server
smtpPort.title: smtpPort

smtpSsl.description: Whether your SMTP server uses an encryption protocol, "true" for SSL, "false" for TLS
smtpSsl.title: smtpSsl

smtpSslOverride.description: Specify true to use SSL (not TLS) on port 25.
smtpSslOverride.title: smtpSslOverride

smtpStartTls.description: Specify true to force STARTTLS (Opportunistic TLS).
smtpStartTls.title: smtpStartTls

smtpTrustServer.description: Specify true to explicitly trust the certificate presented by the SMTP server (not recommended for production).
smtpTrustServer.title: smtpTrustServer

enableCloudCommunication.description: Set to true to allow communication between your server and our cloud system. Doing so enables billing and license sync.  Please see: https://bitwarden.com/help/self-host-an-organization/#step-4-setup-billing-and-license-sync
enableCloudCommunication.title: enableCloudCommunication

annotations.description: # - Annotations to add to the Ingress resource.
annotations.title: annotations

className.description: Current supported values for ingress type include: nginx
className.title: className

enabled.description: Set to false if using a custom ingress
enabled.title: enabled

labels.description:
nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/force-ssl-redirect: "true"
nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/use-regex: "true"
nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/rewrite-target: /$1
nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/proxy-body-size: 500m
nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/proxy-read-timeout: "600"
nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/proxy-send-timeout: "600"
nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/proxy-connect-timeout: "600"
# - Labels to add to the Ingress resource
labels.title: labels

paths.description: Ingress path configuration - The samples provided are for Nginx. Examples with other Ingress providers are in the chart Readme on GitHub
paths.title: paths

clusterIssuer.description: Cluster cert issuer (ex. Let's Encrypt) name if one exists
clusterIssuer.title: clusterIssuer

labels.description: Custom labels to add throughout the installation
labels.title: labels

nodeSelector.description: nodeSelector and tolerations defined here will apply to all templates in the Helm chart. They can be individually overridden
nodeSelector.title: nodeSelector

enabled.description: Set to true to enable refresh tokens.  Recommended for production environments.
enabled.title: enabled

volumeAccessMode.description:
Specifies the access mode for persistent volume claims.  This should not be changed in most cases, and the allowable
values are only ReadWriteMany and ReadWriteOnce.  Please read https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes/#access-modes
to better understand these options before changing this value.
volumeAccessMode.title: volumeAccessMode

global.description: Global values are values that can be accessed from any chart or subchart by exactly the same name.
global.title: global

enabled.description: Enabled by default, disable to retain resources after uninstall
enabled.title: enabled

securityContext.description: Set security contexts for pre- and post-install hooks
securityContext.title: securityContext

rawManifests.description:
You can specify raw Kubernetes manifests that will be applied before or after the base Helm install.
Please see the chart README in GitHub for more information and examples.

postInstall.description:
E.g. add a custom certificate to your bitwarden installation.
- apiVersion: v1
  kind: ConfigMap
  metadata:
    name: cacert
  data:
    rootca.crt: |
      -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----
      xxxx
      -----END CERTIFICATE-----
postInstall.title: postInstall

rawManifests.title: rawManifests

secrets.description: Secrets are required.  Review the chart README on GitHub for details on creating these secrets

secretProviderClass.description: Secrets can either be created via 'kubectl create secrets' or by using a secret provider class.  If using the latter, specify the name here
secretProviderClass.title: secretProviderClass

secrets.title: secrets

serviceAccount.description: Configure service account for pre- and post-install hooks

deployRolesOnly.description:
Certain instances will require the creation of a pre-deployed service account. For instance, AWS IAM enabled service accounts need to be created outside
of the chart to allow for setting of permissions on other AWS services like Secrets Manager
deployRolesOnly.title: deployRolesOnly

serviceAccount.title: serviceAccount

sharedStorageClassName.description:
Specify the name of the shared storage class
This storage class requires ReadWriteMany.  You will need to provide your own storage class.  Storage classes with automatic volume previsioners are recommended.
sharedStorageClassName.title: sharedStorageClassName

supportComponents.description: Images used for jobs and init containers
supportComponents.title: supportComponents
